page.title: 09ECOLOGY, FROG HALL
page.content: ECOLOGY; FROG HALL. One of the finest examples of conservation. This area is in the outer perimeter of the grounds and includes the lake. Here nature is rampant with growth, the honeysuckle and ivy climb the trees unchecked. The undergrowth of many different grasses Bracken,Nettles,Willow Herb, and heathers being home for rabbits & moles.The call of the pheasant reminds one that birds are also welcome. Following the path through the wooded area noticing toadstools,the fungi on dead tree trunks, flowering forget-me -nots,tansy,mayweed,& countless other wild flowers one finally reaches the pond. The pond is quite a busy part of the grounds, it is brought to life with geese, ducks,&moorhens, it is also of area iimportance. See;- Local History.
